Reviews.Title: Great Compact point & shoot for the money, battery is a non- issue
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "tcaseyrochester"
Reviews.Content: Technology marches on. I am an avid amateur photographer with 50+ years of experience with every film and focal plane technology ever created. This camera is my latest "pocket camera" to have with me 24/7, it's for those unique unplanned shots that always pop up when you least expect them and when your DSLR is just not an option to lug around with you all day.Some have criticized the change from AA sized batteries to a Canon propriety battery pack. Hogwash. Technology is going to move forward and the use of a battery pack simply does not mean this camera is any less useful. When you travel into the great whatever with an older camera you thought ahead and took extra batteries with you. Now you think ahead and make sure your battery is charged and yes if you will be away from an outlet you take as many extra battery packs as you need. I am guilty of not thinking ahead plenty of times with the AA technology with no means of stopping into a store to buy more, this camera is no different.The feel and user friendliness of this camera is outstanding. The controls are simple, the instructions (PDF on-line only) are clear and easy to follow, and the image quality is great. You are not going to shoot that perfect close-up shot of a running back diving across the goal line with this camera, but for every day snapshots it offers a nice, cost effective solution to carry in your pocket every day.It's not a DLSR. If you want a full featured high performance camera you'll need to spend a lot more money!9/30/2013 addition- the more I use thus camera the more I like it. The autofocus feature is very fast, and images shot at max optical zoom are beyond my expectations, far superior to earlier Canon point and shoot products.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: begoodorbegoodatit
Reviews.Content: I was sketical about buying this camera. It should be stated that I am not an owner of a DSLR or Nikon, although I've used those before so I know how some who may own those and buy a camera like this may be disappointed or find it less than great. I don't really think it's fair to rate this compared to those kinds of cameras so I am comparing it to my previous "point and shoot" camera.We had some traveling coming up and wanted a new camera since my current camera looks in really bad quality at night time or dim lighting (like concerts). So I opted for this camera with the Black Friday sale. I've taken multiple shots with this camera and my old one to see what the difference really is and I will say that this camera shoots way better. My old camera in natural light in my home would be dark, this one is naturally very bright. If I took a photo of a carrot peel with my old camera it would just look like some orange thing, whereas with this camera the carrot peel looks way brighter, the image is sharper, you can see the details such as texture or drops of water on the carrot unlike the old camera. I did go outside and try to take photos and while this does shoot better at night than my other camera, there isn't even a night time option so I'm still having that issue of the photo comes out with the bright lights looking hazy, but it's an improvement from the other camera we owned.Overall, if you just need to update your "point and shoot" then I recommend this camera. My old camera only had a 10x zoom and it was 8 MP so this was a really nice upgrade. I take photos of animals, food, and landscapes and have been really pleased with the outcome. If you own a fancy camera, you probably won't be impressed with this camera.

Reviews.Title: The Day the Last 2-AA Battery, Travel & Field Camera - Died
Reviews.Author: John Sturgeon
Reviews.Content: As some of you know, the Canon SX100 series are my favorite cameras. I always carry the latest model with me in a video-camera-shoulder-bag (i.e. - "purse" for dudes,) everyday, wherever I go. I have owned and used all of them from the SX100 to the SX160. I have long-considered the Canon SX100 line of cameras to be "The Best 2-AA-Battery All-Purpose Travel and Field Cameras Ever Made." I have posted 5-star reviews of both the SX150 and SX160 here on Amazon during the last two years, and I have made it abundantly clear why I feel so strongly favorable of them.Accordingly, I bought a new Canon SX170. I tested it out to compare it. For sentimental reasons, I intend to keep it. But for the most obvious of reasons, which I just indicated in the above statement, I'm not pleased with it. To the contrary, I am deeply saddened about what has now been completely lost to all consumers, worldwide - The day the last full-featured, full-manual-control, compact, 2-AA battery, travel & field camera left on the entire worldwide market - Died.Here is a summary of my comparative conclusions.&&&&&&&&&&&&&SX160 IS vs. the SX170 IS - A CAMERA COMPARISON - THE BOTTOM LINEThe Canon SX160 runs on 2-AA rechargeable batteries.The Canon SX170 runs on a Canon NB-6LH proprietary battery.Other than the battery, the two cameras are virtually identical.I will start with the conclusion first - There is no serious reason even to consider buying the new Canon SX170 instead of the previous model Canon SX160 ... unless you absolutely HATE using 2-AA rechargeable batteries in a camera.Both cameras have exactly the same features, the same functions, and the same specs - except for the batteries. Cosmetically they are virtually identical cameras in almost all respects except for a small change in the shape of the grip on the right side of the SX170 camera. Functionally they both work exactly the same, and they both produce identical quality pictures. No changes were made to either the sensor or to the DIGIC 4 image processor to bring any improvement to the final images produced.The initial Amazon release price of the SX170 is $179. (Sept. 2013)The current Amazon price for the SX160 is $144, about $35 less. (Sept. 2013)Literally, you have to HATE using 2-AA rechargeable batteries in a camera to want to pay $35 more for the same camera with a mini-sized proprietary battery that will only take about half as many shots with each charge, when the quality of the pictures you get will be absolutely identical with both cameras.SPARE BATTERIES.  Amazon is currently selling official Canon brand NB-6LH spare batteries for about $38 apiece. (Remember, people, your camera warranty is now VOID if you use a "cheap Hong Kong knockoff" proprietary battery in it. You do so at your own risk.)  A spare pair of top-quality Sanyo brand "eneloop" rechargeable AA batteries can be bought on Amazon for about $4, but even "cheap" AA batteries won't void your warranty for the SX160.CAVEAT EMPTOR.That is the bottom line.&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&SX160 & SX170 - BACKGROUND INFO & THE "2-AA" BATTERY CAMERA.The SX170 is the seventh model of the Canon SX100 line of cameras. This series began with the SX100 in the year 2007.  From the beginning these cameras have always run on 2-AA rechargeable batteries. That has always been their strongest selling point - the fact that they use 2-AA batteries.  If you happened to run out of rechargeable AA batteries, you could always buy spare AA batteries for them to keep taking pictures.That is the main feature which made them ideal travel & field use cameras literally anywhere in the world.The cameras of this SX100 series were all full-featured, with full manual control, and a good megazoom.  They were also very affordable. Spare batteries for them could be purchased easily and economically. So these cameras were also inexpensive to use, too. And if you bought a new camera, you just transferred the rechargeable AA batteries to the new camera. You never had to buy any new (and much more expensive) proprietary batteries each time you bought a new camera. So in the long term, the AA battery cameras were always much less expensive for people to own and operate.The new model SX170 no longer uses AA batteries. Instead it uses a mini-sized NB-6LH proprietary battery. These batteries are not readily available except by mail order unless you happen to live near a very large city. If you are traveling, the situation gets much worse. In many places the NB-6LH batteries will not be locally available at all.  So the usefulness of the SX170 as a travel & field camera worldwide has been negated. If you are stuck in the middle of nowhere with dead batteries, then you are just stuck with no more pictures!During the last couple of years, these Canon SX100 series cameras were the only full-featured, 2-AA battery, travel & field cameras still left on the world market. The SX160 was the last one. Now the consumer can no longer buy a full-featured 2-AA battery camera at ANY price, except for a few leftover models from previous years. And soon enough they will be gone too.Some of you may realize the gravity of this loss, others may not. Most people don't miss things until they suddenly realize they can no longer buy them, because "they" don't make them anymore. And that is exactly what has just happened here.  The day the SX170 was introduced was the day the last full-featured, full-manual-control, compact, 2-AA battery, travel & field camera left on the entire worldwide market - Died.&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&ERGONOMICALLY - THE "NEW" GRIPThere is a "not-so-new" larger grip on the right side of the SX170 camera. Canon claims it has "introduced" a design change with a larger grip on the right side of the camera for better one-handed shooting. Ergonomically. This will indeed be a fine feature for many people. I agree. But Canon's P.R. department says this was only made possible by using the new smaller proprietary battery. No. That is not true.The original camera of this line, the SX100, had that same style, larger right hand grip on it, and it used 2-AA batteries. Canon removed that feature from the next model, the SX110, and made the overall camera flatter. Some of us would have preferred that Canon not make that design change, but that was Canon's decision.Now Canon is "reintroducing" that larger right hand grip feature with the SX170, but it has nothing to do with having to drop the 2-AA batteries. I measured the two cameras with a set of calipers. The dimensions of the larger grip on the right side are very similar on both cameras - the grip on the original SX100 (using 2-AA batteries) and the grip on the new SX170 (using the new proprietary battery.)  Canon could have "reintroduced" this same design change all along on any of the other SX100 series cameras, and still kept the 2-AA batteries in the camera just fine. So the justification Canon is giving for being able to make this design change is completely bogus.&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&RATING THE SX170I'm giving the new Canon SX170 IS a 3-star rating only for sentimental reasons - it's still a Canon.  It is still an excellent camera in many ways. It still has all of the same excellent features. ... But I won't recommend the SX170 to anyone.Since it now runs on a proprietary battery, then it has to be compared to all of the other similar cameras today that run on proprietary batteries. And in that comparison, it does not measure up very well.&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&WHAT THE SX170 IS NOTThe Canon SX170 is not a fast-action camera, and it never will be. It still has all the same problems of the previous models. It has a noticeable shutter lag, a slower focus, a slow image processor, a slow maximum shooting speed of 0.8 fps (less than one picture per second,)  a very slow flash recovery time, it doesn't work very well indoors or in low light, and it does not shoot full 1920x1080 HD video, either, only the older 1280x720 quasi-HD video.The SX170 is not a good camera for taking pictures of fast-moving children or pets, fast-action sports moments, or fast-focus views of flying birds. The SX170 simply won't work for that kind of photography.There are literally dozens of other more modern proprietary battery cameras out there today that can run circles around the slow-performing, antiquated design and performance of the older-design SX170. So if you really want a modern, fast-action camera that works well in low light and that also shoots full 1920x1080 HD video, then why would you even consider buying the SX170?Canon designed the original electronics for the SX100 line of cameras way back in 2007.* These cameras were originally designed as, "Stand here while I take your picture" cameras. And basically that is what they still do best. Changing the battery isn't going to change the primary use for which these cameras were originally intended. No more than injecting "energy steroids" into an old dog is going to teach it to do new tricks.If you want a modern, fast-action, full-HD video camera, then the SX170 will simply not work for you.*** Actually it was released in 2007. Design precedes release by about 2 to 3 years, so essentially these cameras were designed almost ten years ago. Remember what that world was like? Digital cameras were low quality and high priced. Most people did not have PCs, and fewer still knew how to use Photoshop. Computer hard drives were 30 gigabytes - smaller than a standard 32 GB SDHC camera memory card of today. Photo paper for printers was terrible and would begin to fade out within months, gone altogether in a few years.  .... Most people were using 35 mm film cameras with 36 shots for each roll of film, paying $27 or more at 75 cents per print each time for all the photos, both good and bad. (There was no "preview" feature before they were developed and printed. Besides, you could not "preview" photos very well by squinting at a tiny, color-reversed film negative.) ... Most people could not AFFORD to take more than a few pictures each month. Taking pictures was expensive! Every single picture had to count, so yes - literally - using a camera back in those days meant, "Stand here while I take your picture!" It didn't MATTER if they were slow. Getting your "36 prints" back from the developers at Long's Drug Store took two to three days anyway.  That is the world in which the electronic circuitry for these SX100 series cameras was originally designed.** (If you do want that however, which obviously many people do, then for a short list of modern, fast-action, full-HD-video cameras in a similar price range of the SX170, please see my post of suggestions in the Comments Section, page 1. For a comparative list of (almost all) current Canon point-and-shoot and bridge cameras, please see my post in the Comments Section, at the bottom of page 4.)&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&FOR A CLASSIC CAMERA WITH FULL FEATURES, USING "2-AA" BATTERIES, CONSIDER THE CANON SX160.If, on the other hand, you do like the classic Canon SX100 series camera line - as I do very much - you have to like it for what it is. It is an older style, classic design, point-and-shoot camera. As such you simply have to accept the fact that it has some very real limitations. And those limitations are not going to be "fixed" simply by putting a different battery inside the same camera.It makes no sense to buy a camera first, expecting it to meet your wants and needs, and then end up being disappointed when it doesn't.  It works the other way around. You find the camera that actually does fit your personal wants and needs first, and then you buy that camera for yourself and enjoy it.If you do prefer the convenience of owning a classic design, 2-AA battery, travel & field compact camera, then I suggest you consider buying the Canon SX160, on sale now, while the supplies still last. That is what I chose to do. I bought two more SX160 cameras, and tucked them away safely in a storage box for my future use and enjoyment for the time when my current SX160 either wears out or breaks down. If you are interested in the SX160, please see my own previous Amazon review of it - 5 stars and more, if I could.The Canon SX160 is still my number one favorite camera I have ever owned, and I still plan to keep right on using it for many pleasant years yet to come.Sincerely, and with best wishes to everyone,  John AKA SLOphoto1&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&POST MORTEM - USING  "AA"  BATTERIES AS A RELIABLE POWER SOURCE.Energy independence. That is one of the main reasons why some people - like me - have been fighting so hard for so long trying to keep the last remaining full-featured AA cameras on the market -  If you can choose your own AA batteries in a competitive market, then you have total control over your own power source. And there is no future time limit for being able to still use your camera, either. ("They" don't make that battery any more.)I still have my original digital camera, an Epson PhotoPC 600, from 1997. It runs on 4-AA batteries. It still works well, and it still takes some interesting pictures.  They are particularly interesting because the pictures have an "older" look to them, because of the older camera technology. I don't have to fake this "older" look with special effects in a modern camera or with Photoshop manipulation. They genuinely look older because they really are "older," due to the older technology actually producing them inside the original camera right now.Imagine trying to locate a proprietary battery for a fifteen to twenty year old camera? The only reason I can even still use that camera at all is precisely due to the fact that the camera was originally designed to run on 4-AA standardized batteries. The same thing will be true of the SX160 cameras of today. Fifteen or twenty years from now, they will still work just fine, because they were designed to run on AA batteries.AA batteries were standardized way back in 1954. Almost 60 years later, in 2013, they are still the most widely used standardized battery in the world. And especially now that they make rechargeable AA batteries (as in "green" - reusable and even "renewable" if you use a solar-powered AA battery recharger,) there is virtually no doubt they will still continue to be very popular for at least another 60 years into the future, too. They are and will continue to be a very reliable source of power - for millions of different items. This will still be true long after the proprietary - and non-standardized - batteries of today will only vaguely be remembered as a passing fad (and expensive folly) of the early 21st century.Non-standardized products have no long-term future in an increasingly globalized world.That's my personal opinion about it, but speaking as a retired history teacher I am also asserting that based on actual and repeated long-term historical patterns and precedents.Again, best wishes to everyone - John AKA SLOphoto1&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&UPDATE: A FEW WORDS ABOUT BATTERY USAGE - HOW MANY PICTURES PER CHARGE?I've been asked to comment on battery usage. How many pictures should a person expect to take with each charge? Here is some data on that. This includes an actual field test I did myself of the earlier model SX150.The proprietary battery in the SX170 - the Canon brand NB-6LH - is rated at about a 1060 mAh (milliamp hours) charge. The preferred, high-quality Sanyo brand "eneloop" rechargeable AA batteries are rated at about a 2000 mAh change (or about twice as much.) There is no great mystery to it. 2000 mAh of power will take about twice as many pictures as will 1060 mAh of power.The SX160 and SX170 each require about 2.1 to 3.7 volts to operate the cameras. That requires either one NB-6LH proprietary battery (at about 3.7 volts) or two "eneloop" AA batteries at 1.5 volts each, (two for a total of about 3.0 volts.) The NB-6LH costs about $38 on Amazon. A pair of "eneloop" AA batteries costs about $4. Either system requires less than one cent of electricity to recharge each time. However, the NB-6LH will probably recharge only about 700 times, based on typical lithium-ion battery life spans, which have a pretty high burn out rate, whereas the "eneloop" brand AA batteries are advertised as being able to take at least 1500 recharges.I haven't tested the SX160 and SX170 cameras yet for the number of shots they will take per charge in actual field use (where you are actually using the camera under field use conditions,) but I did do just such a test earlier for the SX150, and here are the results. (Reprinted from my earlier review of the SX150.)&&&&&&&&&"On a recent field trip to the local mountains near Monterey, CA, I set out with a fully-charged pair of eneloop AA batteries in the SX150, and I carried a backup pair of eneloop AAs just in case. I did a full day of shooting with 425 full-sized JPEGs and 8 minutes of HD video, and I used a lot of zoom and frequently turned the camera off and on too. That is a LOT of battery use for one set of AA batteries. The batteries finally ran out early the next day as I was testing some of the features on the camera."&&&&&&&&&Based on previous experience, when I actually get around to doing an actual, full-day field test of the SX170, I anticipate the results to be about half the amount of the results I obtained for the SX150 (or would similarly expect with the SX160, since the electronic circuitry is basically unchanged in all these SX100 series cameras.)&&&&&&&& PLEASE NOTE: These cameras all show a "low battery" indicator based on a sensor which looks for a voltage drop. In the SX160 and in previous models, these cameras were designed to use regular Alkaline AA batteries which start out at about 1.5 volts (3.0 volts for two of them.)  When they begin to drop too low, the low battery indicator appears on the LCD screen. Rechargeable AA batteries like the Sanyo brand "eneloop" type only recharge to about 1.2 or 1.3 volts (or 2.4 to 2.6 volts for two of them.) The internal sensor will "think" that they are running "low" long before they actually run out, once they begin to drop below the "warning point" for the internal sensor in terms of "low" voltage. They are not actually anywhere near "out." My advice is just to keep right on using them until the LCD on the camera finally tells you to "change the batteries," as it shuts down on you.I hope that gives everyone a fairly good idea of what to anticipate with both the SX160 and the SX170 cameras in general terms of the number of pictures to expect per charge.Again, best wishes to everyone, John AKA SLOphoto1&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&UPDATE: Sept. 30, 2013 - DESIGN FLAW DISCOVERED IN THE SX170. POTENTIAL DAMAGE TO THE CAMERA.Recently while testing the Canon SX170 camera in the field I discovered a serious design flaw.  This flaw became apparent entirely by accident through normal use of the camera. It seems that the camera suddenly and unexpectedly turns on or off simply while handling it in a routine manner. This is especially true when trying to pull the camera out of a coat pocket, purse or camera carry bag.Apparently in one of the few design changes, Canon has now relocated the On/Off power button almost to the very end of the right-rear-top of the SX170 camera (literally, only about 1/4" from the right rear corner of the top of the camera.)  This is the side where the new larger right-hand grip is also located. It is the natural hand position to reach into your coat pocket or carry bag and grab the camera by the main grip in order to pull it out.  When you do, if your thumb happens to be on the top of the camera, you can very easily activate the camera and possibly jam or even break the lens-extension mechanism.When the lens pushes out against a resistance (like still being confined partially inside a coat pocket,) then the lens stops and retracts, and there is a series of several quick "beeps," similar to those of the time-delay shutter release.  The more serious aspect of this is that each time this happens it puts stress on the delicate gears inside the lens-extension mechanism.  Eventually this type of stress can cause the lens-extension mechanism to fail, and the camera will no longer work. (You see them on eBay, "Lens won't extend outward.")Back in 2008, Canon faced a similar problem - and a number of lawsuits - over this very same problem with one if its "G" series cameras. If the extending lens hit an obstacle, the extending lens would sometimes jam and the camera would become altogether inoperable until it was factory repaired. (And the warranty only lasts one year.)The SX160 did not have this design flaw, nor did any of the other previous SX100 series cameras before it.  All six of the previous models of the SX100 series cameras had the On/Off power button located safely inward toward the center of the camera by at least 3/4" to 7/8" from the right end of the camera.I've taken a total of 58 shots with the SX170 camera so far, and this "accident" has already happened to me three times. This same easy activation has also suddenly turned the camera off twice while I was simply standing there holding it. This design flaw is an accident waiting to happen.I don't know how much of this type of stress the lens-extension mechanism on the SX170 can take. I have never encountered this problem before with any of the other six models of the SX100 series that I have owned and used previously. They all had the On/Off power button located well inward at a safe distance from the right end of the camera.  So I have never previously encountered this sort of "activation by accident" with the SX160 or any of the other previous cameras of this line.  But this flaw does have the very real potential to cause serious damage to the camera, and even render it completely inoperable, just by the ease with which the SX170 can be so readily activated just by complete accident.Earlier I said that I would not recommend the SX170 over the SX160 to anyone. Now I must say that I specifically recommend against it.Once again, best wishes to everyone,  John AKA SLOphoto1&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&& FIN.

Reviews.Title: Not Impressed
Reviews.Author: Elana M. Wilkins "letsgoplaces"
Reviews.Content: Not impressed for a couple of reasons. I am comparing this to the SX260 which I bought a few weeks ago. The SX170 feels like plastic while the SX 260 feels much more sturdy. The flash on the SX170 is manual and while I dont care for the placement of the flash on the SX260( under your left fingers as you hold it) I do like the idea that it is auto when you want it to be. I love the grip area on the SX170 for holding the camera steady but the LCD screen is awful on this camera. SO GRAINY....what a shame!! I dont get it. Why would they use a screen that looks this cloudy grainy and unclear?? In comparison to the SX260 which is crystal clear that fact alone made me send this camera back. The 99.00 deal I got was great but honestly the LCD would bother me the entire time so it wasnt worth it. I own mostly canon and Panasonic Lumix cameras and I can depend on the photos being amazing with both brands so it comes down to cosmetic issues for me and the little things like plastic feel and grainy LCD didnt cut it for me on this camera.Forgot to add that it doesnt come with the USB cable either and while I do have a few of those MANY people would not. I find it odd that they wouldn't include something so basic. It has nothing to do with the performance of the camera, just sayin'....

Reviews.Title: A fine little camera and some great customer service
Reviews.Author: Steven C. Simmons
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for my wife, who wanted something better than her cellphone. She is a birdwatcher but not a fanatic, and wanted something with high resolution and good optical zoom while being small, light and simple to use. This seemed to fit the bill. Unfortunately, when it arrived there was a distinct set of flaws in the images produced, with small but visible blotches on the images. We contacted Canon about this, and were extremely impressed with their response. Within a few minutes we were through their voice response system and speaking to a real service person. She clearly knew the camera. After less than 10 minutes with her trying various fixes, she agreed the camera was defective. Canon emailed me a pre-paid return label with full insurance, saying they'd have the camera repaired and back to us in 15 working days. The actual turnaround was 8 days, and this at the height of the Christmas rush. We received a new rather than refurbished device, along with an extra battery and additional strap for our trouble. The new camera works perfectly, with my wife having some gorgeous shots of cardinals at the bird feeder during a snow storm. She is happy with the device, and we're both very happy with Canon service.

Reviews.Title: I love the low light video capture
Reviews.Author: Fillionista
Reviews.Content: The most frustrating part was waiting for the lithium battery to charge, but after that delay, I love this camera. I don't do smartphones and I bought the Canon SX170 IS for its video capabilities. It seems smartphones have almost killed the low end dedicated digital video product category, but the slack has been taken up by what seems (to my armature sensibilities) to be excellent video capture in low-end 'still' cameras. I was not expecting any great low-light video capability when I ordered this camera, but I just took a very acceptable video of my cat lit by a single desk lamp, at night. The white balance adjustment seemed very good too. Previously, earlier in the day, I tested the video with available light from two windows on a cloudy December afternoon . . . handheld. It worked great. I don't normally gush about new gadgets, but I am very happy with this camera. It is just EASY to use. I strongly recommend also buying the Canon USB Cable IFC-400PCU and downloading the Canon software for this camera. This is how I transfer video and images from the camera to my desktop. You will also need an additional memory card.

Reviews.Title: Funny nobody is looking at the sensor
Reviews.Author: Vinayak Raghuvamshi
Reviews.Content: While most of the cameras have migrated to cheaper CMOS sensors, this camera still uses CCD and produces really smooth images.It is funny why people are paying more attention to batteries than the sensor.However, it is also funny that some people think that AA batteries are used only in third world countries. Maybe, but then they are the ones who need decent cameras that cost under $200.Bottom line - if you feel inferior using AA batteries, go with this camera. For the rest of the folks, just get the SX160. Both use CCD sensors which is what many old timers like myself really miss these days.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX 170
Reviews.Author: Carole Davis
Reviews.Content: Great little camera for the price.  I would recommend it for any amatuar photograher.  It is really easy to set up and use.

Reviews.Title: Not a great point and shoot, for indoor or kid-based pix
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Kelly
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a carry-around camera model that would serve as a good alternative to my husbands clunky, cumbersome (to me) DSLR.  Specifically, I need something to have on hand for events for my children's school and generally capturing family moments.  I had read a number of reviews.. unfortunately, I had not read this one..."The Canon SX170 is not a fast-action camera, and it never will be. It still has all the same problems of the previous models. It has a noticeable shutter lag, a slower focus, a slow image processor, a slow maximum shooting speed of 0.8 fps (less than one picture per second,) a very slow flash recovery time, it doesn't work very well indoors or in low light, and it does not shoot full 1920x1080 HD video, either, only the older 1280x720 quasi-HD video."~ By John Sturgeon (Monterey, California)http://www.amazon.com/Canon-PowerShot-SX170-Digital-Black/product-reviews/B00EFILR6E/And, in the words of another reviewer, there you have it.It is not good with capturing fast-moving children or shots indoors.  It is S_L_O_W, a hand even comes up in between shots asking for you to wait. It does have a proprietary battery, which many are upset about... I'm just impatient to wait for recharging. And, it is constantly _not_ finding the objects that I am interested in shooting (faces of my children), and instead chooses random points in the background - which I found interesting considering I had the subjects faces in the center of my screen.  The camera was trying to be too smart, it seemed.I was ready to return within hours of buying it - my husband thought he'd give it a shot... admittedly, he is more of a camera geek than I am.  Within minutes or reassembling it from its store-packaging, he came to tell me to bring it back.So, if slow-paced, outdoor picture taking is your thing; I guess this would be great.  But, if you were really into that, you'll probably have a high-end DSLR with specialty lenses to suit your subject matter best.

Reviews.Title: forensic engineering
Reviews.Author: bernard harris
Reviews.Content: The camera was purchased to replace another that ate batteries. Even with flash, I was able to secure many shots, includind close up details of accident scenes and damaged equipment, witthout any loss of power.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT, EXCEPT....
Reviews.Author: Cynthia55
Reviews.Content: The LCD display is terrible! VERY grainy. Thought it was settings...no...bought the recommended card... So, you really can't tell if you have taken a great picture or not. Naturally....any of the other features don't matter.STILL I will tell you the pros: small, light-weight; comes with a battery & CHARGER. Charged very quickly. Was easy to set up. From opening up the camera, inserting battery & card, to setting the date/time/other settings & taking a few test pictures all took me less than 5 minutes. Definately am returning this camera. All re-packed & waiting to go back tomorrow. That LCD display is just way too cruddy to justify ANY price. I am very, very disappointed. I would like to get same camera in return, but thinking I will get the same problem back. I don't see many people with this problem...If you have, what did you do?? What else did you buy instead?

Reviews.Title: Good camera!
Reviews.Author: Roy Braughler
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon SX150 for several years which I liked very much, with the exception that it "ate" batteries.  The new one has all the features that I enjoyed on the SX150 plus some new ones, such as the movie button.  This camera also has Lithium batteries which should give much better life than AA batteries.  I like the size and versatility of the camera.  I think this camera is a hit!ROB

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: jama555us
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I bought it, at a major retail store. It is very user friend. The quality of the zoom and the megapixels have to be seen to be believed for the quality pictures. I shared the camera with those at work, and we could see and take pictures of the cars across the street, the stadium and the parking lot, like we were looking at it.While is it not a DSLR camera, it is as close as you get, without the cost or the complexity.  My only recommendation would be to make it a little slender but it really is not that bulky, plus the flash is manual and will only come on once it is manually flipped. Really, these are such minor things on the camera, that they are not even worth complaining about. Plus the rechargeable battery holds the charge for a long time.I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Pictures were not sharp.
Reviews.Author: Robert B. Ferguson
Reviews.Content: I tried every setting available, then tried to sharpen in PS.Pictures just not sharp, I wanted to use it in auto mode.The focus seems to not be spot on.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowershotSX170IS
Reviews.Author: Michele Hopkins
Reviews.Content: I wanted this camera because it is very similar to the one I had previously, Cannon Powershot SX110 IS. The only thing I didn't look at is what kind of battery this one had. I think it will be cheaper not having to buy batteries, but think that I would rather buy batteries then worry if the battery for this camera will go dead because I forgot to charge it. Has more photo options then my last camera and it takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: My opinion
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: The camera isn't user friendly. Im still trying to figure out how to review pictures taken.No instruction book included in the box.

Reviews.Title: always the greatest
Reviews.Author: barbara james
Reviews.Content: i started out with the first canon sure shot , have owned one ever since, its the best camera to me ever made. i have had 3 or 4 of them and they have been in my pocket or purse every single day since my first purchase , they have been to europe and were still going strong to hawaii and then to norway , my canon will be with me always, it captures the best pictures, would not buy another brand but canon for me , for someone else no, but mine will be canon

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Hamauchi
Reviews.Content: I bought this just to have something in my car for the purpose of being able to capture a shot here or there that I wouldn't get since I don't carry my DSLR around with me all the time. I was shocked when I got it and found all the settings that were on this camera which were for the most part the same as my DSLR. . .Auto, Live, TV, AV and Manual. There was also a setting for portraits, fisheye and discreet which lets you take a picture with no noise from the camera. It also has a video function and a small flash on the top of the camera. It takes decent enough pictures and is easy to use. I would recommend it to everyone to use for every purpose and it has a 16X digital zoom.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX170-IS
Reviews.Author: Hil Sybesma
Reviews.Content: This camera is packed with more features than the average user will ever need. Takes great shots and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera.
Reviews.Author: Stanley Torow "st"
Reviews.Content: The instructions are very lean and not very clear. Canon tech support is very good and explained how the camera worked.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Mary Lou Cavallini
Reviews.Content: I especially like the 16x optical zoom.  Not too many cameras have this much zoom.  It is easy to operate and I'm getting great pictures!!!

Reviews.Title: CANON - THERE IS NO SUBSTITUTE
Reviews.Author: L. Suddeth "LuvinFire"
Reviews.Content: I have had other Canons (one in the AS series that I literally wore out) and my current cameras - SX130is and T3i.  For a long time my husband and I have shared the 130 so I decided to get a second point and shoot so each of us could have one which comes in handy on vacation.  Sometimes the T3i is not the perfect camera to grab and take a photo from the car window, but I think this one will be.  This SX170is is a upgrade from the SX160is.  The 170 uses NB-6L lithium batteries so I am hoping that they will last much longer than the AA batteries we use in the 130.  The camera comes in a box with one battery, a charger and a wrist strap.  This camera comes in red and black.  I ordered the red and it is a deep matte cranberry color.  Very pretty.  It does not have a viewfinder but it does have a 3" screen.  The buttons are all the same as other Canons and very user friendly.  The body is slightly smaller and much lighter than the 130.  I have small hands and there is a difference in how it feels due to the placemen of the grip on the front, but it is still comfortable enough.  I have shot moving vehicles and birds with it in "automatic" mode and they came out super clear and sharp with no hint that the subjects were in motion.  I am very please with those test shots.  This camera takes a moment to find it's focus in low light but has no problem with full light.  The 16X zoom is awesome and a zoom  across the length of two football fields comes in very clear.  It can become noisy when cropped at those zooms but still useable.  While the video is not as superior as the T3i, it works for me and I am very pleased with this purchase.  I also ordered two extra batteries and a car charger for it.  Now I am ready for vacation and anxious to try it out on our island retreat in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: Nice for this amatuer...
Reviews.Author: Gladys Gooseberry "Gladys"
Reviews.Content: I love it so far... I haven't tried most of the features yet...  But it is so nice...  And I am certainly having fun with the nice zoom...  :)

Reviews.Title: Canon camera
Reviews.Author: Wayne Warner
Reviews.Content: The PowerShot SX170 camera works great, takes very clear pictures and is easy to operate. It was a super value.

Reviews.Title: nice upgrade
Reviews.Author: StinkySteve
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a replacement for my Canon A1400.  This camera seems to be of much higher quality.  It takes pictures more rapidly and works like it's supposed to.  Well worth the higher cost.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Margaret A Burton
Reviews.Content: My old canon bit the dust.  I had it repaired once but now it's done and been replaced by a newer model.  The new model is heavier but the pictures are much bigger and better.  Technology just keeps getting better.

Reviews.Title: This is one great value
Reviews.Author: Roger D.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for it's high 16 pixel and HD video capability and it proved to be versatile and produced excellent pictures.  However I still have not figured out how to get the flash to function.

Reviews.Title: Ease of Use
Reviews.Author: bob
Reviews.Content: This camera, purchased for a trip to Europe has turned out to be the camera I use all the time. The lens length gives me a bit more flex when using the camera and of course the extreme quality of photos as are all Canon products. Excellent quality.

Reviews.Title: Click and love
Reviews.Author: Amanda Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Great camera and great pictures. I knew from the moment I took my first picture I was in love. The pictures are clear and crisp. Easy functions to figure out. I wish a quick guide manual was in the box. Negative: it sometimes has a hard time removing red eye.

Reviews.Title: Improved over the SX160
Reviews.Author: Andi C Bair
Reviews.Content: Canon SX170 is a small step above the SX160. Let me use my usual disclaimer, in the interest of fairness, and admit that many cameras by reputable makers (and there are many) deliver what they promise. It is more about what camera traits you are looking for. So, I would suggest to anyone looking to buy one to google 'camera trait search' and get the lay of the land.The SX170 is a fixed lens camera (point and shoot, some would say), with 16 resolution (megapixels), and a big x16 zoom. The sensor size is 1/2.3 inch CCD-type, which is standard for cameras of its class.If you were to, say, take pictures of friends and family at an outdoor gathering, this camera is what you need. If you get ambitious, there will be stumbling blocks. Here is the camera's trait mix: It does not have a viewfinder, which, again, many in its class don't. The ISO rating, which is the gauge for how well it does in low light, is 1600. That rating is lower than many others, but it is sufficient for most purposes. The video is a Full HD- that is 1980x1080 resolution. The camera gives you the option to control manually both the exposure and the focus. It does not have a hot shoe for an external flash option. That is not unexpected for its size and category. The LCD screen is a 230,000 resolution. The camera does not do RAW processing but you would need only if you did not want to be limited by JPEG type storage. The weight of the camera is 251 grams, which is light for its zoom.The main difference between the SX170 and SX160:1. SX170 has a doable burst rate of 2.8; SX160 has 0.5. That is useful for fast action pictures.2. SX170 is lighter due to mechanical improvements.Overall, nice camera. Having been into photography for a while, I do stress though that you do a camera trait search. That will also tell you more about what you want.

Reviews.Title: Wow, what a pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Scott Tallmadge
Reviews.Content: Bought to replace an underperforming pocket camera, this model has some more powerful features than my current handheld camera.  Control panel provides easy access to most of the camera's functions.

Reviews.Title: a little disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Carmen A. Jass "CAJ"
Reviews.Content: Battery and usb cord not included. Had to purchase these before I could use the camera.  I didn't catch that I would have to make a trip to store before I could use it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 16 year old daughter who has just started to show an interest in photography. Perfect starter camera. It does allow for the changing of many manual settings as well as takes video. Extremely happy with this camera. Takes great pictures and love the rechargeable battery option.

Reviews.Title: Looks good
Reviews.Author: Valerie, Ohio
Reviews.Content: to be fair, I just got this before Christmas and although I have used it, I haven't gotten prints from it yet.  I hope that the photo quality is as good as advertised.  I thought this camera would be easier to hold one handed (I have a baby and a toddler so I only ever have one extra hand for anything) since I am right handed.  It isn't.  It isn't bad, just takes some getting used to.  The red color is fabulous though.  I can always find it even when I can' remember where I set it down and it just looks so new and smart.  I was looking for an easy set up, click and shoot kind of camera since I want decent pictures but I don't understand all of the features.  This camera is constantly showing me diferent options on the screen and the slightest bump of the dial on the back,  yeah, right where your fingers go when holding with one hand, and it changes the settings.  What a bother!!!  The screen is nice and big and reviewing pictures on it is easy.  The flash is terribly bright though so I am going to have to find someone help me adjust the settings for that.  It is too dark without the flash in my house during the day but the flash has a tendancy to really wash out the people in the pictures.  I know that this is as much operator error as anything.  Be aware, the flash doesn't pop up at all when you need it.  It in fact has to be manualy raised before use and manually lowered.  That was a detail I missed before buying and was a terrible pain when I started using it but I have that down to a habit now and am not bothered a bit.  It makes it easier to get good pictures of my seven month old since the flash doesn't snap open and cause her to look shocked in all of her pictures like my old camera did. I simply raise it myself without any noise and it is ready to go.

Reviews.Title: Canon  SX 170
Reviews.Author: William Morgan
Reviews.Content: I really like the 170...all the new features but above all the new type of battery.Delivery of the camera: as promised. Thank you

Reviews.Title: Amazing Quality for Cheap
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: The SX170 is actually the first camera I've ever owned. I was a bit skeptical at first. because I wasn't sure I wanted this to be my first camera, but I knew I wasn't ready for a DSLR. I'm not that into photography or anything, I just want to be able to take nice, clear, crisp images whenever I can and want. After about a week contemplating, I came down to the SX170 and the Nikon L820. A lot of reviews I read deemed the L820 the clear winner, and there were a lot of negative reviews for the SX170 (partially due to the lithium battery). Both of them have super cheap deals going on, but the Nikon L820 was about $70 more, and a bit more advanced, and bigger than I would like my first camera to be. Plus you needed 4 AA batteries to operate it, and I'm a firm believer in Lithium rechargeable batteries. I decided to go with the SX170, and I haven't regretted it since. I got an amazing deal, the camera, plus a free 16 GB for just $99. I am so happy I bought this camera.I'm still playing around with the functions of the camera, and trying to learn everything and get the the most out of this camera. This is an amazing beginner camera. I have so many people asking me if I took the photos on a DSLR! The quality really is that amazing.The only thing I would have to say is that I still haven't gotten a hold of the focus too well, the camera gets very shaky, when its on full zoom on Manual mode (without a tripod) but I think its something that I remedy quickly once I get a hang of it and maybe purchase a tripod. Overall, this is an amazing little camera, with incredible bang for you buck!

Reviews.Title: Bummed
Reviews.Author: KMF2678
Reviews.Content: I was searching around to replace my Canon Elph which had the color swap function.  While researching I came across the SX170 - I read it's description and functions and saw that it had it.  But when I received the camera it wasn't true.  UGH!!  I really loved the swap function

Reviews.Title: Cool little camera.
Reviews.Author: Cathy Conn
Reviews.Content: Amazon said that I would receive a free SD Card with my order.  I didn't realize that I had to go into another screen and order the SD Card.  I thought it was automatically included with my order.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, but buyers beware!
Reviews.Author: Dr.Who
Reviews.Content: I love this camera very much! The picture quality is great and it is very easy to use. The only reason I gave it 3 stars is the fact that it breaks VERY easily! I dropped mine from 2 feet onto a carpeted area and got a "lens error." To get this fixed, it costs about $130, so be careful with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Young photographer
Reviews.Author: beach granny
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Canon Powershot SX170 for my 12 year old grand daughter.  She loves this camera.  She is really getting into photography, and wanted a nice camera that is easy to use.  This was perfect. Lightweight so easy to carry around anywhere you go. The styling resembles the DSLR's, which was not going to be an option for her as way tooo costly for a teen!  She really adores her new camera, and grandma is so happy with the purchase!!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: GW
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera and VERY well made.  I am really impressed with the quality of the videos and the 'zoom' function.  A perfect marriage of point and shoot simplicity yet all the functionality of a SLR when needed.GW

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: AdrianCR80
Reviews.Content: This was the camera I was looking for and I'm very happy to have bought it. It is small, easy to use, takes great pictures and I have no problem with the battery. The only problem with sending this purchase was that I did not get that memory card I would receive for free with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Features far exceed the modest price.
Reviews.Author: Computer Bob "Bumpy"
Reviews.Content: This one is a winner. It has far more to offer than advertised. After downloading the 100+ page manual, all sorts of goodies popped out. Great creative control, even manual focus, usually found only on DSLR. Picture quality is good, not great, but for the price, it is great!. I also use a high end DSLR, and the main difference is the lens quality and sharpness. This camera still rate 5 stars, because it is a pocket point and shoot. and should be reviewed as such.

Reviews.Title: Swapped for different canon
Reviews.Author: cj
Reviews.Content: Camera was big and clunky relative to performance capacity. Also prefer lithium battery over alkaline which don't last very long!

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: NillaKillaXXV
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Its a little cheaper than some but he picture quality is still amazing. It feels a little cheap but it performs great.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Camera
Reviews.Author: albert byrd
Reviews.Content: This is my second Powershot camera and I could not be more pleased.  The zoom is all that is promised; also, the wide angle is excellent.  Speed is excellent between shots and on start up.

Reviews.Title: Disliked image quality
Reviews.Author: Iconophoric
Reviews.Content: I returned this camera after a couple of days use. The images all seemed to have an over-smoothed, anti-aliased quality coming right off the camera. I tried photographing stationary subjects outdoors, the camera hand-held, in bright early day broad daylight, with Image stablization both activated and then turned off.The results weren't blurry or out of focus. Yet I could tell this camera would apparently never achieve tack sharp focus. The deal-breaker for me was that another very cheap camera that I have at hand -- the Fuji JV100 -- produced sharper/better images of the same photo-op. The Powershot SX170 might well be an adequate camera for the arena of low expectations: for production of icons, thumbnails and small images on the net. But keeping it honest, as an upgrade to a low-end $70 Fuji, this camera fails to measure up.This is not even getting into the battery debate. I am strictly commenting on the quality of images it produces.One thing: Where my latest camera before the SX170 has an image default dpi of 72 (with image widths of 55 inches at 12 mp) when I open pics in Photoshop for post-processing, this camera produces images of 180 dpi at smaller dimensions as a starting point. This difference got me to wondering about how much and what kind of interpolation is taking place with my old camera versus this one.Perhaps the interpolating is where things are being bungled by the camera. Or maybe it is the anti-aliasing filter on the image sensor. All I do know for sure is that I am going to be looking at aspects of new cameras carefully (suspiciously?) that I hadn't considered before -- including, now, any image smoothing (so-called) that a camera may include. At general info sites, this specific information is scant; maybe specialist sites will be able to help.Cannot recommend the Powershot SX170. I had very high hopes for it, but the image quality is just too soft. My experience with this camera makes me wonder if the same could be true of all newer generation Canon 16 and 18 MP cameras within a hundred dollar range of this one. Anyone?If you want to know more about digital camera "anti-aliasing filters", look up "Optical Low-Pass Filter". This is definitely a subject for further research, one on which opinion is divided. But the SX170 earns a definite "No" from me.

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: julia pugh
Reviews.Content: I have been having issues with mine were the batteries just die on me and it says a new set is dead as well. Which I know is not right i have a think to test them, I sent one off to be fixed and they sent me a refurbished well not even having it for 2w it is now doing the same thing and I only had the 1st one for abt 8m. I wish it would not do this I use it for so much now I have to send this one off and I am going to look into  new camera.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: ramona manafi
Reviews.Content: Takes wonderful pictures and is easy to use.  The effects are nice and zoom is as advertised. Great price...Great pictures...Great size... happy buy!

Reviews.Title: Good camera...but
Reviews.Author: sweetpea30
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera but I wish the flash could be automatic if you wanted and I would like it more if it was a bit faster processing between one pic to the next.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera !!
Reviews.Author: erica
Reviews.Content: It was for my 13 year old grandson and he really loves it and go every where with it, to the New York city and Canada (Niagara Falls)and took beautiful pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Just Teri
Reviews.Content: Not a SIMPLE camera but certainly worth learning. I wanted simple but I am getting it. The zoom is a problem for me, you have to hold VERY still or it blurs. Not happy about that, sometimes just pushing the button blurs the picture.

Reviews.Title: Super
Reviews.Author: Eva I.
Reviews.Content: Pretty good, for this price, small and compact, good quality of pictures, gas flash light , good for starting photographing

Reviews.Title: little unhappy and desapointed xxxxxxxx
Reviews.Author: blue
Reviews.Content: Nice looking camera with a good zooming power, but slow to process after picture taken.Got to focus well it will take bed pictures if objects are moving.

Reviews.Title: Cannon SX170 camera
Reviews.Author: Renata D.
Reviews.Content: Love my camera. The pictures come out great. Just wish it would have come with a more extensive manual.  Thanks

Reviews.Title: Camera OK, manual not included
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Brown
Reviews.Content: A major drawback is that this machine, which I haven't had for more than a few weeks and seems pretty easy to use, does not come with a manual.  It is online and you have to download it.  Pain!

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Joaquin V.
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, for the price that I paid for it, it takes awesome pictures and it is pretty stylish. Strongly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Happy customer!!!!
Reviews.Author: Michelle Winston
Reviews.Content: Camera is great!  Only thing I have trouble with is the position of the zoom lever͵ my other Canon has the lever on the back and that is more convenient in my opinion.  Great picture quality though!

Reviews.Title: Love itr
Reviews.Author: Elena Arretche
Reviews.Content: It its the description precisely. Takes good pictures and has a big screen, love it! Excellent zoom, comes without memory card

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Marsha Pressley
Reviews.Content: I have had an older model Canon digital camera. The one I've had for a few years is a Canon Power Shot A570IS. Loved that camera except that the batteries would get eaten up by it. Other than that I loved it, the pictures were clear, it was easy to use and learn. I use my camera in my work/hobby and take several pictures weekly and put them up on my website. I decided maybe the newer model with more pixels might be a better choice and give me better pictures. I bought the camera and ended up returning it to be replaced thinking it was just a defect in that one camera. When I use the auto mode, the flash doesn't like to work if there is a least amount of light in the room and my pictures were all coming out dark. My older model did this sometimes, but not nearly as much as the newer one. So I have the replacement, I THINK it MIGHT be better, but not much. I have to put it in portrait mode for the auto flash to work as needed. That seems to help the problem. But honestly, I would have thought they would improve on the newer camera, with today's technology, I was hoping to be blown away by it. It is a decent camera, I have nothing else to compare it to except my older model. The new model is 16 Mega Pixels. The older was 7.1. I really can't tell the difference.

Reviews.Title: very  satisfied.
Reviews.Author: Shirley Baublitz "scrapbooker"
Reviews.Content: easy to handle and ready to go. clear pictures and I can download to my computer for printing.I had to download manual - would have liked it printed in the box instead.

Reviews.Title: "Take It Everywhere!"
Reviews.Author: Jacque A.
Reviews.Content: I had some doubts when I finally hit the button to purchase this camera. I am so not disappointed. I really love the "look and feel' of it and with the super lens, capturing images at a distance is simply a breeze.  Overall? It is Ah...mazing!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use mediocre image camera.
Reviews.Author: mmacc109 "Mark"
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use as a mediocre point and shoot. I am a die hard Canon fan and was really looking for something with a little more quality images, then I remembered I only paid $130 for it. Nice to have for quick and easy to use camera when you don't really care about enlarging. I had a Canon 5mp small point and shoot 6-7 years ago that had better image reproduction. For the money not a bad camera for it's intended purpose.

Reviews.Title: great travel camera
Reviews.Author: momsmit
Reviews.Content: I looked at a lot of cameras to take with on trips. I have a full sized cannon rebel but sometimes its just to big to take with tosome places. I like the zoom option...nice sized back display area.  Takes very nice professional looking photos. Trust the reputation canon has.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Caleb Moore "son of cohen"
Reviews.Content: Been using for over a year now to do videos and pics. Love the camera and never had a problem. The 50mm lens is a must.

Reviews.Title: A good travel camera
Reviews.Author: Matt07924
Reviews.Content: This camera is an ideal travel companion.  It is small but not too small.  It has optical zoom for those faraway images.  It is Canon quality and all at a decent price.  It's made in Japan so I know the quality is there.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase
Reviews.Author: Sam Sheffer
Reviews.Content: Camera is just what I expected. Quality, price and reliability. Been using Canon's for a while, big fan of their products

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Starwalker
Reviews.Content: It's working great and takes wonderful pictures not just for family, friends and special Occasions. I use it to sell online. I am really glad I bought it. It makes picture taking easier and the quality of pictures makes all of us happier not to be struggling with picture editing.

Reviews.Title: Great features
Reviews.Author: WickERM
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most beautiful cameras , easy to use light to carry and very good. I love that with just a click of a button I can transfer my photos from my camera to my cellphone.The new model has a few more bells and whistles, however this one is great and does everything that I wanted it to do. Shot video and snapped some nice pictures so far. I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: Awesome lightweight camera
Reviews.Author: Dorothy Thompson
Reviews.Content: I am absolutely LOVING this camera.  I thought it would be a little larger going by the picture but in all respects, I rather like it.  It's a powerful little camera.  You can do so much and it's not heavy to carry or cumbersome to pack in your purse. I bought the carrier which was a little extra and I love it.  My daughter's graduation is soon and I needed something fast but I didn't want to rush into things so I did a little homework.  What I liked about this was the wifi feature.  My daughter got everything set up for me which didn't take long but the wifi part she was having a little trouble with although she said if she wasn't rushed, she would probably be able to figure it out.  But you know, that's a nice added plus, but since I bought the cord (extra) that hooks to my computer from the camera, it was simple to download them on the computer and make them smaller using my graphics program to put the pictures up on Facebook.  My son seems to think there's a setting on there to downsize the pictures and I'm sure there is but I was just so excited to get it, that part didn't even matter to me at the time.  I haven't tried the video function but it looks super easy.  Overall, this is a terrific camera and I would highly recommend it.  Love it!  Oh btw the picture quality is EXCELLENT.

Reviews.Title: good quality
Reviews.Author: Robin Lacey
Reviews.Content: This camera is a bargain. It takes great really pictures. The price is low, but the quality is very high.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: yarregu1
Reviews.Content: Pretty good quality, sometimes pictures come out a little fuzzy- just have to work with the settings. Great optical zoom.

Reviews.Title: Excellente cam!
Reviews.Author: Luis Borges
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent camera. The photos look great, is some noise on the screen only when you are in dark places, but in places where light is sharpen the image on the screen. (That is not a fault, the photos are great!)It is not a professional camera, it is a high quality camera for people like me that I do not do photography professionally.It also has very good video quality. Thank you very much to Amazon and Canon.No need to pay for a more expensive camera (if you're not a professional photographer). This camera is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Recommending
Reviews.Author: Dragan Nakic
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera. I was using it and it is in perfect condition as described. I recommend it for all next buyers. Really enjoy using it

Reviews.Title: PowerShot indeed
Reviews.Author: Sam-Wise
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera with a 16 gb memory card and battery for $99.  Great deal, and five months later it is still selling for $50 more at Wal-Mart who just started carrying it last month...  Great deal, and a great product!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX170 IS 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 16x Optical Zoom
Reviews.Author: holmes19
Reviews.Content: still getting used to using the new camera...so far pics are very good....was unhappy that manual didnt come with camera and needs to be downloaded from website...tried but had problems

Reviews.Title: Camera...
Reviews.Author: Kevin F
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item as a gift so have no real first hand experience with the camera itself.  Although I have received several compliments from the person I purchased it for.  He and his family sure seem to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Karen Dean
Reviews.Content: Camera is nice and I like it, I do wish it would have had a detailed instruction with it so I know what I'm doing.

Reviews.Title: Canon sx 170
Reviews.Author: richard aspi.wall
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera so far.I have not had a chance to use it much yet.pictures are clear and the zoom works nice

Reviews.Title: camera canon powershot
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: The camera was as expected, it is really great, my friend is happy with her camera, actually I just bought it here but it is not mine.Thanks for the good service.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Joan Ryberg
Reviews.Content: This camera makes great pictures and is easy to operate.  I would recommend it to all my friends.  Price is right.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera, Great Quality Build and Pictures
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: This is about the best Digital Camera you can get for less than $200 and before you step up to Either a DSLR or something even better. It's light, yet rather durable and feels good in your hands. The pictures are outstanding, especially during Mid-Day captures, but even under really bright surroundings or low light situations, the camera performs marvelously. I've always leaned towards Canon products, whether it be Camera's or Printers or Anything else, and I have yet to be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Diaper Bag Camera
Reviews.Author: Raven "Mama to 3 young kiddos"
Reviews.Content: I am a canon girl, but I refuse to keep my professional camera with me at all times. I was lugging my Rebel around, but even that got to be a pain. This allows me to shoot in manual mode, the flash won't ruin your photos as it doesn't use flash unless you raise the flash up. Has video mode, which is nice to be able to get short clips of videos of my kiddos. I also love that the battery unit is rechargeable. Some complain about this, but I love it. If you need to buy a back up battery, it's not expensive to do so.

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever!!!
Reviews.Author: Catherine Comparoni
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It is super awesome and I love the features.  The first day I got it, I couldn't put it down.  Can hardly wait to put this camera into use.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Hansel Garcia
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it is more than I expected.  I have made ​​photographs did not know I could capture.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: JME
Reviews.Content: Just what I was looking for. It's small yet has great zoom. I am very please with the photos I have taken with it. The only thing is that it didn't fit into the case that came with the bundle.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Alcides Rivarola
Reviews.Content: This is really a great camera, compact one but with a nice 16x optical zoom, ready to carry on trip, the pics are just fine. The videos are just great and the battery last quite long.It worth buying it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot option
Reviews.Author: Sebastián Peña
Reviews.Content: If you want a class A product without spend tons of money, i totally recommend this.The pictures are awesome and there has lots of predefined configurations so you dont waste the time reading manuals with 1000 pages :)I am very satisfied with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Canon PoweShot Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Ortencia Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Works great. I love it to my trip to LA and capture great pictures. Its good deal the price was good.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera 4 stars-I like the zoom and the weight along with great pictures it takes.It's a little complicated but I'm finding my way around how it all works.Good camera!

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Jessica Pham
Reviews.Content: Just what I expected from a camera. It is perfect and takes amazing pictures. I love this camera and the price is amazing!

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera
Reviews.Author: Diana Fabia
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera for the price- auto function is great- adjusts settngs for you.Anti Shake is an amazing feature.Recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: My first Camera
Reviews.Author: Luis C.
Reviews.Content: I mean, how can you just hate this camera? Is the first camera I have bought by my self, is really good, battery life is like a lot, I mean I've used it like in 10 activities and I've charged it only once, amazing, really good pictures and fast shots, just perfect

Reviews.Title: Good quality A+
Reviews.Author: Nabil K.
Reviews.Content: Very good and compact! Easy to use! For the price very good to use daily, amazon has the best price!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Judi Buller
Reviews.Content: I've had Canon cameras before and still use the  larger one, but this compact camera is perfect for my purse and does excellent quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: really like this one
Reviews.Author: Melly
Reviews.Content: I've had Nikon and Canon cameras and prefer the Canon. I've found the brand to be easier to use and more reliable with better pictures. I really like this camera but give it 4 stars because you're limited without it being an SLR. But it's more compact, easier to use, and cheaper than an SLR. I got it to replace another one I broke doing a face-plant out in the wild! It does the job well.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Matthew Hilliard
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, price is good too.I will find another one which can PK with it, may be better quality.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Tracy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for our teenage daughter. She loves it. It does everything she needs it to do. The one thing I think it lacked is that it did not come with a case. That would be my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Patricia Murphy
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price. Simple to use for the amateur photographerThe LED screen is a little grainy but it does not hinder the quality of the picture. Battery life is good. Great bang for the buck. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Tina Williams
Reviews.Content: I loved this item I had only used it a few times at home but last night went out for the first time. It took great pictures at my sons cadet military ball and I just love the camera period. I am still using the same battery and have not had to charge it yet. When I got the camera the battery had a little charge but I went ahead and gave it a full charge and though I have only taken a few photos the battery has maintained its charge and it's been a few weeks....Well worth it...

Reviews.Title: Youtuber**
Reviews.Author: Porsha Law
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera if your just starting on youtube* It got my channel on the right direction because I had great camera quality*

Reviews.Title: love
Reviews.Author: Mo
Reviews.Content: I'm loving this little camera, great buy at the right price.  I would not hesitate to purchase from this buyer again. the camera is as it was advertised, actually I would say better than stated. happy customer.

Reviews.Title: I'm enjoying It!!!!
Reviews.Author: Eshe
Reviews.Content: Everything came just at stated and on time.  I love my new cam and I have already started doing my YouTube vids. You can check out my channel [...]And I know I can do so much more with that cam, that I haven't even explored as yet.

Reviews.Title: Liked by person I bought it for.. but..
Reviews.Author: S. Morris
Reviews.Content: .. it did not come with accessory cords nor the SD card ... yes was a great buy, and said either refurbished or used,, just disappointed to hear lack of cords it came with and no SC card,, but as for being a camera.. works great!

Reviews.Title: A great gift
Reviews.Author: Richard & Roxann Ellis
Reviews.Content: Got this for my husband . It's perfect for him. Takes nice pictures and is easy to use..He loves it..

Reviews.Title: Cute shape and size nice clarity
Reviews.Author: Sivakumar R
Reviews.Content: Worthy to buy at this price. Nice Clarity and good resolution. Easy to operate. Sound recording is also good. Very

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Tara Kushnir
Reviews.Content: Our daughter was able to begin taking great pictures rigjt away. She finds it easy to use and convenient to slip in her bag

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Dr. Eason
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera because of the way it looked and because of the simplicity of use.  I love it.  It takes great pictures, it really is easy to use, it's lightweight and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a great camera that is inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: chad
Reviews.Content: nice camera  i needed a new one and found this camera at a reasonable price it was a good buy

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX170
Reviews.Author: Penelope Towle
Reviews.Content: Good take along camera, do wish the ISO was a bit higher in this one.  Difficult to shoot at night.  Also difficult to shoot (focus) on long distance shots.  Close ups work great.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX170
Reviews.Author: Penelope Towle
Reviews.Content: Good take along camera, do wish the ISO was a bit higher in this one.  Difficult to shoot at night.  Also difficult to shoot (focus) on long distance shots.  Close ups work great.

Reviews.Title: A nice alternative....just not for me!
Reviews.Author: KHickman
Reviews.Content: When I received it the condition was brand new. It's a nice alternative for a point & click camera, just not one that I was used to previously. I could not get a clear action shot with it nor was it as clear as I'd hoped it would be. I recommend the Casio Exilim over this since that's what I had previously when going on my world travels and I took absolutely amazing & breath taking photos with it.But if you don't have high expectations and the size works for you then by all means try it!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera at a good price!
Reviews.Author: Steel
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera! Great photos. A true point n shoot camera. Although I love it,  if I had to do it again I would buy the SX160. After doing the research I found the only difference is the price. The 160 goes for 100 bucks!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX170 came with minimum items
Reviews.Author: Part Time Hiker
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera, and it does have some great features. It is all plastic, and not what I expected as far as quality. It also came as a stripped unit with no memory card. This is most likely due to the promo. I have done a number of shots, and the camera does focus up close, has a quick processing speed and at the price I paid, is acceptable. I would not pay the retail price for what I received.

Reviews.Title: Happy buyer
Reviews.Author: corinne
Reviews.Content: It was great but there are some functions on the camera that don't work well or it doesn't have like the flash won't work and it doesn't have a self timer

Reviews.Title: Easy Camera for the older generation
Reviews.Author: David L Frazee
Reviews.Content: We bought this for my 70 year old father. Really Great Camera. Easy to use with great picture Quality. Would buy again

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: Pamela S. Frederick "pfrn1997"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter-in-law and she loves the camera. It's a cannon so I had no worries about the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Only one downfall...
Reviews.Author: SteadyProfitz
Reviews.Content: Very good point and shoot camera for someone who likes taking pictures every once in a while. Here is where most beginners get confused...Once they get this camera, you're going to take a picture and look at it through the LCD display and see that it's not very clear, in fact, it looks a tad bit blurry. This has nothing to do with the quality of the picture once it's uploaded onto the computer. A lot of people think that how it shows up on the screen is how it'll actually look on the computer. No, the 16MP is the highest you could get before jumping up to the top of the line DLSR cameras.So just remember, this is a VERY good camera for the price but do not be misinformed by the look of the picture on the screen versus how it actually appears on the computer.

Reviews.Title: Great buy, no cord and/or memory card.
Reviews.Author: Alexandria Kitts
Reviews.Content: I'm overall pleased with this purchase, I was a little disappointed that neither a cord or a memory card were included but I had a space card and just used my ps3 controller cord to hook it up to my computer.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Joan Spinner
Reviews.Content: I just love the wide angle lens. The camera is a bit heavier than the old one I had in my purse but the pictures are so good so I'm happy with it. The 16X zoom makes for a great close-in picture. The only wish I have is that the lag was even shorter and the lens a little faster. The auto stabilization works well but I still get blurred shots with moving targets even when they aren't moving fast. Then I really need my DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Ordered it two days before Christmas for my girlfriend and received it Christmas Eve - Thanks Amazon, you guys ROCK!
Reviews.Author: M. Brontsema "az_climber"
Reviews.Content: The Canon is also sweet. I have a Powershot G9 and G15 and for as cheap as this SX160 is in comparison it is worth it! Excellent zoom and fantastic pics, lightweight and small - Perfect for hiking and backpacking trips.

Reviews.Title: Still looking for another
Reviews.Author: Backwoods "ekjk"
Reviews.Content: Returned not happy with the quality of pictures, tried all the different setting manual and auto.  OK, if your not concerned with the sharpness of the pictures, which based on the 5 stars reviews seems to work for many people.  Based on the many complaints of other type cameras with less than desirable quality of pictures, suspect the older point and shoot were much better.  Older Nikon L16 (inexpensive) puts our some great clear pictures but horrible on batteries.I found the menu user friendly compared to others, plus they have some great u-tube videos available.
